name: TheAtlantic
text:
.@BTS_twt are the first artists to land a Korean song at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100—and they did it without the help of U.S. radio.

@lenikacruz on why the Grammy-nominated pop septet’s hit single “Life Goes On” is resonating with millions: https://t.co/1HyO56KuGE

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past few weeks have offered a preview of what Donald Trump’s post-presidency might look like: The president fulminates at length, playing pundit, but is a practical nonfactor in policy discussions," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/38TQRBlVIg

name: TheAtlantic
text: For four years, North Carolina has prohibited towns and cities from passing new protections for LGBTQ people. Today, that ban expires. But what comes next is uncertain, @giuliaheyward reports: https://t.co/SqSuhHyEKk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Looking at sparkly pictures from the Hubble space telescope might make some of us feel small—but that can be a good thing, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/JdMyLrDpp0

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A vaccine is waiting on the other side of this pandemic winter. But before the temperature rises, and before the vials are distributed, Americans will have to find ways to remain safe inside, at home," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/Egd4GFHuNv

name: TheAtlantic
text: The first two COVID-19 vaccine trials went pretty much perfectly. AstraZeneca's did not. Here's what to expect from forthcoming vaccine trials, from @sarahzhang: https://t.co/MOVqKlBYTK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: "Just as polls show Arizonans—especially those in the suburbs—souring on Trump, the state party has veered sharply to the right."

https://t.co/xIhgbQVwCQ https://t.co/F4Tw4jOKZb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s veneer of invincibility is fading. He lost his bid for reelection, and staged the most incompetent coup attempt since Woody Allen’s 'Bananas,'" @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/YPTYEAeXNb

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When parties commit themselves to minority rule, the backlash can be severe. While the letter of the law allows Republicans to control the Senate and the judiciary, the spirit of republican government demands otherwise," @kenneth_owen writes: https://t.co/d35Ye5g64W

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: Day 2 of the Hubble advent calendar: A spiral galaxy that looks like a cosmic frisbee flying through space https://t.co/ncW6cxSof5 https://t.co/lKXp39B8y2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "With avenues for dissent vanishing, it looks likely that resistance to the Hong Kong government and its mainland Chinese backers will morph, growing subdued within the territory but more vocal among the city’s diaspora." — @TMclaughlin3 https://t.co/tomvfnGuqJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/1PIqhgESB0

name: TheAtlantic
text: The former space-shuttle commander Mark Kelly is being sworn in as Arizona's newest senator today. With his win, @marinakoren wrote last month, Kelly joins an exclusive club of astronauts turned politicians: https://t.co/wEY2uUAVb1

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos: The Reality of the Current Coronavirus Surge - 31 images from around the world of some of the health-care workers, victims and families enduring the crush of new COVID-19 cases over the past few weeks. https://t.co/mPxqCNrqhu https://t.co/h1rcEyULbL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: I love this @marinakoren piece on the allure of astronaut politicians https://t.co/3mhIbbm3LA

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: Mark Kelly is being sworn into the Senate today. Here's my piece on astronauts turned politicians, and here's a great quote from an astronaut who didn't run for office (but maybe should have) https://t.co/kJiF6bkzmD https://t.co/n6PlYAO2si

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: "Challenged by numerous protests over the past decade, the Hong Kong government’s response has been to see fault everywhere, and with nearly everyone, except itself and its policies."

Make sure to read @TMclaughlin3's latest in @TheAtlantic https://t.co/tomvfnY5Pj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: Hard to believe it's December 1 but I'm excited for @kokogiak's annual Hubble advent calendar. It's the 13th year Alan is doing this. Bookmark it for a few moments of wonder this month. https://t.co/ncW6cxSof5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Those who lived through Hurricane Katrina have a story to tell—a story of rumors, betrayal, and one of the most misunderstood events in American history. Listen to their stories on “Floodlines,” named one of the best podcasts of 2020 by Apple podcasts: https://t.co/qTuC340uyo https://t.co/9lPK6P6bwV

name: TheAtlantic
text: HBO could have highlighted the brutal reality of intimate-partner violence in ‘The Undoing.’ Instead, the show tries to seduce viewers with murder, @eveagerber writes: https://t.co/lUqKtfNI6l

name: TheAtlantic
text: It’s Spotify Wrapped season. In 2018, @haleysweiss explained why people are hooked on Spotify's year-end wrap-up tool, even in an age of data mistrust: https://t.co/tKHVtTKP4W

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: 1. More than two decades after Attorney General Bill Barr successfully sued the Village of Airmont for zoning out religious Jews, Barr takes the Village back to court for doing the same thing. https://t.co/UUQnK5Nbzt
